intro: Seseli delavayi, commonly known as Delavay's seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Seseli delavayi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
